alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 7:51PM MDT until April 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM SUNDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF THE REGION DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .An extended period of widespread critical fire weather conditions will impact the region through Tuesday. The focus will be across eastern NM through Sunday before spreading to much of the region Monday. Critical fire weather may persist into Monday night across parts of eastern NM before redeveloping over many areas Tuesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM to 8 PM Sunday then again Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West-southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph Sunday afternoon. West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to between 5 to 10 percent Sunday and Monday afternoons. Several hours of single digit relative humidity are likely. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
